Title: Visa restrictions and urgency of good governance: Matters arising
Summary: Restrictions on international travel being imposed on some countries, including Nigeria, connote serious implications that require significant measures by Nigeria to protect the interests of its citizens .

Title: Super Falcons captain dedicates WAFCON win to Tinubu, others
Summary: Rasheedat Ajibade dedicates WAFCON win to President Bola Ahmed Tinubu, the Super Falcons, and every child who believes and dreams of attaining success . Captain of the team dedicated the team's victory at the just-concluded Women’s African Cup of Nations .

Title: Tinubu honours Super Falcons with national awards, cash gifts
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has conferred the national honour of Officer of the Order of the Niger (OON) on all 24 squad members . The Super Falcons won the Women’s Africa Cup of Nations (WAFCON)

Title: Motorsports can boost youth employment, innovation in Nigeria – Moses
Summary: Chief Executive Officer of Triumph Fleet, Engineer Triumph Moses, said Nigeria’s emerging motorsports industry holds immense potential to create employment for engineers, technicians, and young people exploring alternative career paths . Speaking during a press briefing in Abuja, Moses said motorsports can boost youth employment, innovation in Nigeria .

Title: NiDCOM, Sydani, FirstBank launch ‘Home and Abroad’ platform to empower diaspora Nigerians
Summary: Sydani Group in collaboration with Nigerians in Diaspora Commission (NiDCOM) and FirstBank Plc, has officially launched the Home and Abroad Platform . The platform is a secure and tech-enabled solution designed to help diaspora Nigerians .

Title: NCoS, REA sign MoU to power prisons, empower inmates
Summary: The Nigeria Correctional Service NCoS has signed a Memorandum of Understanding MoU with the Rural Electrification Agency REA . The MoU aims to provide off-grid electricity for custodial facilities as well as training inmates on renewable energy .

Title: Our resilience saved Nigeria education from total collapse under Buhari – ASUU
Summary: Academic Staff Union of Universities, ASUU, says resilience saved Nigeria education from total collapse under Buhari . ASUU said that but for its resilience, the Nigeria public university education sector, would have totally collapsed during the immediate-past administration .

Title: Alleged python killing for ritual sparks tension in Bayelsa community
Summary: Tension has gripped Opu-Nembe Kingdom in Nembe Local Government Area of Bayelsa State . Alleged python killing for ritual sparks tension in the community . Remains of a python reportedly buried within the community are said to have been buried .

Title: Trump warns of ‘real starvation’ in Gaza as aid deliveries pick up
Summary: US President Donald Trump warns of ‘real starvation’ in Gaza as aid deliveries pick up . Aid agencies sought to take advantage of an Israeli "tactical pause" in fighting to rush in food aid .

Title: Councillors suspend Niger LG chairman over alleged constitutional breaches
Summary: Councillors of Chanchaga Local Government Area in Niger State have suspended the council chairman, Aminu Ladan, from office . They have alleged breaches of constitutional guidelines and misconduct .
